name: Hotel Golden City - Garni

reviews.title: Satisfactory hotel for the price
reviews.text: Thought I’d write up some thoughts from a recent stay at the Golden City to clear up some misinformation in some past reviews.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the hotel is cheap and is in a good location. Its pretty easy to get to from the airport (even with luggage.) The staff is extremely helpful- they have transit passes you can buy from them (no extra charge) and will help translate Czech to English, etc. The breakfast spread is substantial – we noticed many patrons spending much more time than necessary in there to try all the goodies. The mini bar prices are the same as Tesco’s.
reviews.title: Absolutely Satisfied!!!

likes.liked: — it was quite close to the city center, the room was huge and very comfortable

reviews.text: The unexpected: Prior reviews imply that the hotel has universal wi-fi coverage. This is not so, many of the rooms do not access. The beds are not western style beds. They are some kind of sofabed with the back folded down and used as a “mattress”. Our’s was uneven and lumpy so we named ours the “bed bowl” owing to the concave shape. The towels are indeed like cardboard (as another reviewer had mentioned).
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, easy to get to city centre
likes.disliked: — Rooms are none smoking but smoking on corridor and smoking area makes the corridors smell

reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel!
reviews.text: Overall, it was better than a typical motel in the US but lacks some standard comfort features.

We are a young couple from Greece and we stayed in Golden City garni in February.The truth is that we chose this specific hotel based on the trip advisor reviews which were absolutely helpful, also corresponding to reality.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is priced appropriately for is services. It is located on the hill away from the main centre and the Old Town, but is right on the tram line. Tickets for the tram can be bought at Reception.
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate accommodation
Average Hotel
reviews.text: The rooms are OK - maybe a little on the small side. Also, with all the rooms facing the street, they can be a little noisy, with the trams running past the hotel from 5AM until late at night.
Breakfast is OK - plenty of choice. Good restaurant choices for dinner around about - cheap and good food.
reviews.title: One of the worst Hotels of the entire trip
For the price this was excellent and fulfilled our needs
reviews.text: Laundry service was non-existent when I needed it - not part of the hotel, but close by. Laundrette manager was extremely unhelpful - but can't blame the hotel for this.

description: Hotel is situated in central Prague's Zizkov district, close to Wenceslas Square 15 minutes walk and well connected to many of Prague's major attractions, including the city's historic Old Town, New Town, Lesser Town and Prague Castle. Lipanska tram stop is situated in front of the hotel. Public means of transportation in Prague are clean, quite comfortable and cheap.
